intro: Hieracium erioleion, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium erioleion is often considered a weed but plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
